item.title: Only 1 chance to log in? + magic runs up to npc
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

if(k == -1) { if(i1 == 0) { if(loginFailures < 20) { try { Thread.sleep(2000L); } catch(Exception _ex) { } loginFailures++; login(s, s1, flag); return; } else { loginMessage1 = "No response from loginserver"; loginMessage2 = "Please wait 1 minute and try again."; return; } } else { loginMessage1 = "No response from server"; loginMessage2 = "Please try using a different world."; return; } } else { System.out.println("response:" + k); loginMessage1 = "Unexpected server response"; loginMessage2 = "Please try using a different world."; return; } }

heres the orginal code… the copy and paste messed up the 1st copy… heres is what i have… Could u re-write it with this?

COULD IT BEE THE DOUBLE CODE???

item.title: Only 1 chance to log in? + magic runs up to npc
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“Illadelph, post:1, topic:470536”]pi
317
when u try to log in with wrong password it says invalid pass 1 then log in again wrong pass says no response from server… how can i fix heres the code i assume doin this

if(k == -1) { if(i1 == 0) { if(loginFailures < 20) ------- this was 2 b4 i changed it to 20 thinking it would fix { try { Thread.sleep(2000L); } catch(Exception _ex) { } loginFailures++; login(s, s1, flag); return; } else { loginMessage1 = "No response from loginserver"; loginMessage2 = "Please wait 1 minute and try again."; return; } } else { loginMessage1 = "No response from server"; loginMessage2 = "Please try using a different world."; return; } } else { System.out.println("response:" + k); loginMessage1 = "Unexpected server response"; loginMessage2 = "Please try using a different world."; return; } }[/quote]

That should’ve fixed it. Or just delete it
